episode_title: 324 - The One With The Ultimate Fighting Champion

content.description: Central Perk, the whole gang minus Monica is there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you think that there’s a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you’re driving into town there’s-there’s like a sign, and it says “You’re in Sample.” (He says it like urine sample.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How’d it go with Pete?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tell us!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over…

content.speaker: Billy Crystal
content.text: I’m sorry. Ex-excuse us. I’m sorry, it’s a little crowded. Do you mind if we… (motions to the couch)

content.speaker: Robin Williams
content.text: Yeah, could you scooch?

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Yeah, move over just a little bit.
(Rachel, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey all scooch over to let them sit down.)

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Keep on scooching.
[cut to Monica telling the gang about what happened at Pete’s]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm…
(Robin interrupts her again by complaining loudly to Billy as the camera cuts to them.)

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Why? Why?! What’s wrong with me?!

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: I have a feelin’… I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.
(The gang is now eaves dropping in on the conversation, and is shocked.)

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: How do you know?

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Well y’know, he’s got access.

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Y’know it’s that feeling you get, y’know?

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Like when you go bowling and you know you’re in somebody else’s shoes?

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: That’s the one.
[cut back to the gang.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, so, so you went to Pete’s…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I…
[cut to Billy and Robin]

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Why is this happening to me?! I don’t know, maybe it’s my wound.
[cut to the gang]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Forget it. (they all turn and listen to Billy and Robin)

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: So it’s-it’s not heeled yet?

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: No-no, it’s ooozing, oozing. (to Rachel) Could you pass me the cream? Is there any—Oh, there’s the cream.

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and nobody else.

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: What is it, Tim?

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: It’s me, I’ve been sleeping with your wife.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’re the gynaecologist?

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Hey, I’m trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!

content.speaker: Robin
content.text: Ooh, (to Rachel) Can I have a napkin, please? Could you please hand me a napkin? (Rachel tries to grab one, but is to slow for his tastes.) Would you—Give me this thing (grabs the napkin holder from her.) all right!! Enough! (to Billy) And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! (gets up to leave) Nada!! No more! You are a bastard for doing this!! (Billy follows him) Get away from me!!

content.speaker: Billy
content.text: Thomas, come back here! (they both leave)
[cut to the gang, they’re all stunned]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So Monica, what were you gonna tell us?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have no idea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, come on, what was the big news Pete wanted to tell you Mon?! Or should I say Mrs. Monica Becker?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no-no oh, keep your name, don’t take his name.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He didn’t ask me to marry him.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then definately don’t take his name.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He wanted to tell me he’s gonna compete is some ultimate fighting competition thingy.

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Pete?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?! What is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know exactly. It’s-it’s sorta like wrestling.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but without the costumes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And it’s not fake, it’s totally brutal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s two guys in a ring, and the rules are: “They’re are no rules.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you can like, bite, and pull people’s hair and stuff?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, anything goes, except ah, eye gouging and fish hooking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s fish hooking?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh, what’s fish hooking… (Joey sticks his finger in Ross’s mouth and pulls on his cheek, y’know like when you hook a fish.) (to Joey, sarcastic) Thanks man, that would have been really hard to describe. What is that taste?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? My hands are totally clean, I just gave the duck a bath.

content.description: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing a meeting with his boss.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: So thanks for the warm welcome. It’s good to have you guys on my team, and I come to play. I hope you do too. Now, let’s go out there and get ‘em! Huh? And remember, there is no ‘I’ in team.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but there’s two in martini, soo everybody back to my office.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: You! Chuckles! What’s your name?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh it’s Bing, sir. I’m sorry , I was just ah…

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: No-no, I heard what you said, funny. I like funny. (Chandler starts to leave) This team is about hard work, but it’s also about having fun. Good to have you aboard Bing! (smacks him on the butt, and Chandler leaves shocked.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is making reservations.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, Ryder. Wynona Ryder for six. (listens) Thank you. (hangs up) (to the gang) Yeah, we have the reservations.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right buddy, way to go! (smacks him on the butt)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you! Today, my boss keep slapping my butt and he was acting like it was no big deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeesh, what’d you do about it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I didn’t do anything. I didn’t want to be the guy who has a problem with his boss slapping his bottom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gotta tell ya, I think it’s okay to be that guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, maybe it’s like y’know, that jock thing. Y’know how football players pat each other after touchdowns. (pats Ross on the butt)
(Ross throws his hands out in a “What are you doing?” gesture)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know I don’t, I don’t understand guys, I mean I-I would never congratulate Monica on a great stew by y’know, grabbin’ her boob.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know, for a really great stew you just y’know, stick your head in between ‘em.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, can we please go eat?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. What are we getting?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anything but stew.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right so, Chandler, from now on, don’t give your boss a chance to get you. Y’know just ah, don’t turn your back to him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, or you can teach him a lesson. Y’know? What you could do is you could rub something that really smells on your butt, all right? Then, when he goes to smack ya, his hand will smell. (thinking aloud) Now what could you rub on your butt that would smell bad?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What if Joey were president?
(Monica, Ross, Chandler, and Joey exit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, hey Rach, can I ask you something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you can totally say no, but umm, would it be okay with you if I set Ross up on a date?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, ah with who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, my friend, Bonnie. She just always thought Ross was really cute, and now that you two aren’t together, she asked if I could set it up, but if you’re not cool with it…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh-oh, which one is Bonnie again?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You remember her from my birthday party two years ago. She’s yeah, like, average height, medium build, bald…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (laughs) That’s fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Okay, good for you! (as they leave she slaps Rachel on the butt)

content.description: A Gym, Pete is training for the Ultimate Fighting Championship, with his trainer, Hoshi.

content.speaker: Hoshi
content.text: You are iron. You are steel! Let me ask you something, how come when I call your computer support line, I have to wait an hour and a half?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I told you, we’re adding new operators all the time. Could we concentrate on my training?

content.speaker: Hoshi
content.text: It’s just hard when I know I have e-mail I can’t get !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Monica! (runs over and kisses her) Hi honey.

content.speaker: Hoshi
content.text: All right, on the table. (Pete gets on the table for his rubdown)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, umm, so listen umm, my friends were telling me a little about this ah, ultimate fighting thing and it, well it sounds really dangerous. I-I don’t want you to get hurt, ‘cause I kinda like you.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, believe me, I don’t want to get hurt either. I’m being smart about this. See these guys? They’re the best trainers in the world, and Hoshi here used to be a paid assassin. (Hoshi yells at him in Chinese) A house painter! He used to be a house painter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Promise me you’ll be careful.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I promise.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, are we still on for tonight?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, good, ‘cause umm, well maybe we could have a little workout of our own…

content.speaker: Hoshi
content.text: No! No boom-boom before big fight!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How ‘bout just a boom?

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with Bonnie, as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that was depressing, I think I just bought a soft pretzel from one of the kids from Fame . Ready to go to the movies?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um-hmm. Oh wait! This is Bonnie. (who has hair by the way)

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is Bonnie? (to Phoebe) This is Bonnie? (to Bonnie) You’re Bonnie?

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: I can show you an ID if you want?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, I’m sorry, you look a lot different from the last time I-I saw you.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Oh yeah, well I just started wearing bras again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that must be it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I hope you have fun tonight.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Thanks! You too.
(Phoebe starts to leave, Rachel slowly follows, shocked about how good Bonnie looks now.)
[cut to outside of Central Perk]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You said she was bald.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, she was bald, she’s not now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How could you not tell me that she has hair?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, I hardly ever say that about people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, well, this is just perfect!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I’m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick. I mean, y’know, that girl has hair got all over head!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe it won’t work out. Maybe Ross won’t like her personality.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why, does she have a bad personality?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, Bonnie’s the best!

content.description: Chandler’s office, Chandler is bent over getting some water as his boss approaches.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing! (Chandler stands bolt upright and turns around to face him.) Read your Computech proposal, a real homerun. (He goes to slap his butt, but Chandler slides over making him miss.) Ooh. Barely got ya that time, get over here. Come on. (Chandler goes over) Wham! (slaps him on the butt) Good one. That was a good one. (to a couple of Chandler’s co-workers) Keep at it team. (goes into his office)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is with him?

content.speaker: Phil
content.text: With him? You’re is favourite, you’re his guy!

content.speaker: Stevens
content.text: We never get smacked.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s not true, he-he smacked you once.

content.speaker: Phil
content.text: Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.

content.speaker: Stevens
content.text: I’m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting Dartmouth in the fall.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth sucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No sir.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: There you go. (smacks him on the butt)

content.description: The Ultimate Fighting Championship, Ross and Monica are there watching Pete.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: walking up with this huge tub-o-popcorn and drink

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God Ross, what is that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!

content.speaker: Announcer
content.text: From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He’s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!
[Pete enters with his entourage all pumped up, and Ross and Monica are the only ones who stand up and cheer.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you, Pete!!!

content.speaker: Announcer
content.text: And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He’s a 300 pound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!!
(The crowd goes wild, and Ross is the only one boo-ing him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pete! Pete!! That guy’s pretty huge!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Don’t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.
(Pete and Monica kiss, and Monica mouths “I love you.” to him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right! You go get him! Let’s go!

content.speaker: Referee
content.text: Here we go gentlemen, here we go! (to Tank Abbott) Are you ready? (He nods, and takes out his teeth) (to Pete) Are you ready? (Pete nods, “Yes.”) Let’s get it on!!
(They both rush each other. Tank picks Pete up and carries him over and slams him into the fence surrounding the ring.)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Uh-oh.
(Tank carries Pete over to the other side of the ring, and we see both Ross and Monica wince in pain.)

content.description: The Arena, after the fight. Monica is walking up to a defeated Pete.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! (she sits down next to him) It’s me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant “You suck!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: What, look back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you’re not gonna get going are you?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, no. But…

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well I’m not gonna stop until I’m the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad’s garage, there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t know that already?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Look, I’m gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, just get a lot better. (pause) Fast.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have affected my concentration.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. That-that was the problem.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s balcony, Ross and Phoebe are grilling some burgers and hot dogs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! How long until Pete’s fight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, about five minutes. Right now they’re interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hot dog?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Four, please. (Ross looks at her) I’m really nervous. (Ross gives her the four dogs) Thank you. (she grabs four buns, and heads back inside)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn’t expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn’t expecting to like anyone right now, but she’s really terrific.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, that’s too bad!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I-I’m saying I liked her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, y’know what, there are other fish in the sea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, I think she’s great. Okay? We’re going out again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Which one’s my turkey burger?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, the fight’s starting!
content.parenthetical: sticking his head out the window

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, we’ll be right in. (to Chandler) So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it’s gonna be okay, because as of tomorrow I’m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fight’s over!
content.parenthetical: sticking his head out the window

content.text: (Chandler, Ross, and Phoebe all stop dead in their tracks at the news.)

content.description: Chandler’s office, Chandler is confronting his boss about the butt smacking thing. His boss is writing on a white board.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me, Doug? (no reaction) Hey there sports fan!!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing! You got those numbers for me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I ah, I didn’t do them.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh, you forgot?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no I just ah, didn’t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don’t deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. (laughs) That’s okay, you’re still my number one guy! (slaps him on the butt) Bing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Doug!!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I gotta tell ya, if it is, you can just… kiss my ass!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no. It-it’s not about the swearing, it’s more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, and don’t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It’s just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it’s making all the other guys jealous.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Well, say no more. Y’know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You’re okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (he starts to leave)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Ha! (goes to smack him on the butt, but stops, faking Chandler out) Ahhhhhhh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhhh! (walks out, imitating shooting himself in the head)

content.description: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are talking and walking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Phoebe look, it’s Ross and that girl.
content.parenthetical: seeing Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk

content.text: (We see Ross and Bonnie laughing and having a good time.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! Look at that! (drags her away from the window) It’s a line of ants! They’re working as a team!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe! (goes back to the window)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let’s go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that’s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that’s what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! (walking away from the window) Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he’s gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You said it was okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You said she was bald!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, we can’t, we just can’t just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don’t get it. Aren’t you the one that decided that you didn’t want to be with Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well isn’t he your friend? Don’t you want him to be happy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just y’know, I didn’t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh! (sits down on the curb)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no.
content.parenthetical: sits down next to her and hugs her

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, we killed them all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!
(They both jump up and wipe off their butts.)

content.description: A locker room, Pete is in a full upper-body cast. Monica enters, sees him, and gasps. Pete tries to turn around, and winces in pain.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: It’s okay, it’s not as bad as it looks, it’s a precaution. Ah, I’m not supposed to move my spine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please tell me you’re stopping now.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I’m fine! I’d fight tonight, if they’d let me. (stands up and starts swinging his arms) See this circle I’m marking off here? This is my zone of terror.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I can’t until I’m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I’m telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I’m not saying I could beat Superman, but y’know, kids are stupid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Y’know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam’s Apple, but that really hurt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well then, y’know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you’re gonna have to do it without me.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well if you’re asking me to quit, then you’re asking me to be someone I’m not. I’ve got to do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then I’ve gotta go. Bye. (kisses him and starts to walk out)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Mon-Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Could you leave a note? ‘Cause I’m on a lot of pain killers now, and I don’t know if I’ll remember this tomorrow. (She leaves.)

content.description: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing up a meeting with his boss and the rest of his team.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: So, in conclusion, the lines all go up (points to the chart), so I’m happy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8:30. (They start to leave) Phil! Nice job. (smacks him on the butt) Stevens! Way to go! (smacks him on the butt) Joel-burg, you maniac! I love ya! (smacks him on the butt) (Chandler walks up) Bing! Good job, couldn’t have done it without ya. (he shakes his hand)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you, sir.

content.speaker: Stevens
content.text: Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase y’know, by accident.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Of course, you did. Forgot something else too ya bastard! (smacks him on the butt) (to Chandler) Well, what about you? You’re not feeling left out or anything are ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No, not at all, that’s-that’s ridiculous.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don’t you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Now get on out of here, you! (smacks him on the butt)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is watching Pete fight on TV. Monica is hiding in the kitchen, not watching.

content.speaker: TV Announcer
content.text: Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he’s just trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I can’t watch this. (turns her eyes away)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check it out, he’s winning! (to Monica) Pete’s winning!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-o-o!!

content.speaker: TV Announcer
content.text: Uh-oh, Bruiser has Becker on the canvas and is going for his favourite area.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! Oh! (they all recoil in horror)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, if that’s his favourite area, why is he being so mean to it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn’t want to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can’t.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh!! (they all start pointing at the screen)
